reviewText: This was a made for television movie featuring Ben Cross, who starred as Barnabas Collins in the Dark Shadows revival series as well as having an impressive career in other roles.  Nightlife is a comedy . . . much like the Mel Brooks film "Dracula, Dead and Loving It".  The plot moves along like it's supposed to be serious but there is an endless array of ridiculous situations that makes it clear it's pure comedy.  The premise is Vlad's love Angelique has been awakened by gravediggers who opened her coffin hoping to find treasure.  Vlad wants her back but Angelique is interested in the doctor who is trying to figure out what her "rare blood disorder" is and clearly hates Vlad.  The ensuing struggle between Vlad and his inept sidekicks against the doctor and his friends becomes a classic "science versus mythology" fight to the bitter end.  If you like vampire comedies this one has all the ingredients you're looking for.
summary: Pure Fun in a Vampire Flick
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie is a good time. Best way to describe it. Yeah, in spite of the various praises for Maryam d'Abo and Keith Szarabajka (who I really liked in the role) or even Ben Cross -- any good actors could have taken on the characters and the movie wouldn't have been all that different.It is Camille Saviola as the in-your-face Rosa Mercedes who rules here. She is absolutely wonderfully alive, sexy, and a total hoot. I loved her. Add her love interest (I hope his name is Jesse Corti) and all is well in the world of filmdom. I'm not sure which is my favorite: Rosa dissing the vampire or Corti calling out to the bloodsuckers and REALLY getting into it.  The two vamp side-kicks were also really good. This is such a funny movie.I've seen this movie over a dozen times. Why don't they put it on DVD?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm mostly interested in adding my plea for this to be released on DVD.  I love this quirky entry in the "Vampires: Myth or Science?" genre.  Keith Szarabajka, by turns the bemused suitor & the excited scientist, is excellent as the hemotologist much taken equally by Maryam d'Abo's deliciously vulnerable vamiress & her baffling "blood disease".  And it is one of Ben Cross' too few comedic turns.  The supporting cast, particularly the uninhibited portrayal by Camille Saviolla of the take-charge maid, is pitch-perfect.  Released in 1989, I think it's has stood up well over time. As what I believe was originally a made-for-TV USA channel production, I don't know what the chances are of it making it to DVD, but I'll bet it would repay the costs not only from it's original devotees, but also from first time viewers who are fans of the stars.

reviewText: This one's not so bad! As a matter of fact, it's quite good! Far better  (and funnier too!) than, say, 'An American Werewolf in Paris', which was  done with a much bigger budget and a state-of-the-art Hollywood production.  Come to think of it, as far as made-for-TV movies go, this one has an above  average script, great performances (although I think the "feisty"  Mexican maid overdoes it badly) and no pretentions whatsoever, which makes  it the more enjoyable!I must confess I like this movie for personal  reasons: One is Maryam D'Abo, the silver screen's most underrated siren and  a damn good actress if given a worthy role. Here she plays a vampiress in  distress and, though the part is no Blanche Dubois for sure, she does it  with gusto and fun!Two, the movie was filmed in my hometown, more  precisely in my neighborhood (Coyoacán), and it's  funny to see familiar  buildings you've known all your life, some of them just around the corner,  as sets for a macabre story. Thank my unlucky stars, I was away in London  while the movie was being shot. ¡Chín! I would have loved to meet Ms. D'Abo  and asked her for an autograph, maybe even invited her an ice cream across  the street!
summary: 'The happiest vampire south of the border!'
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a hilarious take on vampires, especially considering the latest God-awful movie series with the "sparkly" vamps and waaayy too much teenage angst. Nightlife belongs in your collection for many reasons, not the least of which is Keith Szarabajka's performance. He is an amazingly talented actor and is able to hold his own with the likes of Ben Cross. I am anxiously waiting for Nightlife to show up on DVD as I've about worn out my VHS copy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Aaahhhhh, "Nightlife"... I first saw this film on TV and found it reallyentertaining. I've been attracted to the paranormal since I was a kid -ghosts, hauntings in general, elves, first got interested in vampires inhigh school via "Dark Shadows" (a casual friend told me about it)...Anyway, eventually I discovered vampire comedy - and this film is one ofmy favorites. I really get a kick out of that vampire-resistant maid(who's *so* resistant she tells Vlad "Miss Angelique said 'no visitors','are you crazy? you *must* be crazy' and 'drop dead!' before she hangsup on him early in the picture). I do like the leads (Maryam D'Abo,KeithSzarabajka) - Szarabajka's cute in this. 'Vlad', of course, is Ben Cross,who played Barnabas in the brief '90s "Dark Shadows" revival. He playsthe nasty vamp Vlad is supposed to be, while Angelique is trying topermanently ditch him. I won't spoil the rest for you - just, Enjoy! Havea bowl of lightly garlic-salted popcorn for the heck of it. See if youwant this film to join your (paranormal) comedy library!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a huge Ben Cross fan, but this movie his hilarious because of the entire cast!  This was as funny to me as "The Fearless Vampire Killers" and I hope to heck someone updates and remakes that one ***hint, hint***, too! I'll tell you who the scene stealers are in here--even though Ben Cross makes the movie shine:  It's the maid and the boyfriend she finds...Just get it and watch it! This movie will leave you laughing your backsides off! I got a huge kick out of this movie because it's more like a farce to me! It's a brilliant script and it is well executed. Camille Saviola simply rocked in this as did Cross.  I particularly liked the bar scene with Szarabajka...That should leave anyone rolling over laughing...It's worth it and it's a cheap find for those of you Ben Cross lovers out there! I promise you'll get a kick out of it!
